result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan C Mc Bain

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: This case dismissed and read in per dispo in 15CM143 and 15CM146 this date.

Defendant Bryan C Mc Bain in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together for adjourned initial:  15CM172, 15CM146, 15CM147, and 15CM143.  Court asks for def's pleas in these matters:  NG pleas entered in all cases, charges having been stated on the record.  DA states that the parties have these matters resolved but are not ready to proceed to disposition now as agreement requires def's upfront payment of significant $; asks for 6/1 resolution date.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bryan C Mc Bain in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CM172, 15CM146, 15CM147, and 15CM143 called together for adjourned initial.  Court has instructs def to contact SPD re eligibility and report back to the Court his findings.  Matters adj. to 2/3 at 10.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bryan C Mc Bain
Current: 28948 Rabine Lane, Lone Rock, WI 53556 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 1043 N Park St, Richland Center, WI 53581
This bond replaces the previously-set cash bond.
Defendant's statement on bond being posted by TV

Defendant Bryan C Mc Bain in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together, all for adjourned initial appearance:  15CM143, 146, 147, and 172.  Def states he does not qualify for public defender; requests consideration for court-appointed counsel.  Court questions def to determine eligibility.  Def waives right to counsel for the sole, limited purpose of offer exchange with the State.  Court accepts waiver and notes that def is on the line for Dean counsel eligibility; will consider that further at another court date after offer exchange has occurred.  Court adjourns these matters to Dec. 16th at 9. Def asks for review of cash bond amount in 15CM172.  Court admits def to $2k signature bond and directs clerk to release the $1250 cash.  Def states cash belongs to TV.  Clerk requests address and phone number info from TV so that the record on posting can be changed and the money returned to TV.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bryan C Mc Bain in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Formal reading waived. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Reset for October, Def to contact SPD.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
